snippet.title: Why Leaders Need To Be Positive Thinkers
snippet.description: It has recently been reported that high fliers in Britain’s Civil Service are being offered “resilience training” as part of leadership programs to help them cope with the demands of the job in these times of austerity. Civil servants apparently feel under pressure as a result of extensive jobs cuts [...] read »

snippet.title: The Weekly Oil & Gas Follies
snippet.description: The Weekly Oil and Gas Follies – Volume 34, February 24, 2014 In which we drill down into the @GDBlackmon Twitter feed to briefly chronicle the week’s silliness, shenanigans, fake news and real news related to the oil and natural gas industry. This week’s Follies begin with a selection from our Tales [...] read »

snippet.title: Forbes 400: The Richest People In Texas
snippet.description: These are the richest people in the Lone Star State.

snippet.title: All-Star Student Entrepreneurs, Class of 2011: Update
snippet.description: Last August, Forbes published its first-ever list of all-star student entrepreneurs. We found undergraduates or recent grads who had started businesses, or in one case, worked as a venture capitalist, while in school full-time. We looked for significant businesses, generally more than six figures in revenue, and profiled the founders. [...] read »

snippet.title: The World's Most Powerful Black Women 2012
snippet.description: Of the members of FORBES 2012 list of the World’s 100 Most Powerful Women, 11 are black, of whom 3 are Africans. These are the 11 black women who matter the most. read »

snippet.title: Facebook, Under Fire For Lack Of Female Directors, Maybe Needs A List
snippet.description: Mark Zuckerberg at the 37th G8 Summit in Deauville (Photo credit: Guillaume Paumier) Facebook, preparing an initial public offering that could value the social network as high as $100 billion, has plenty of options for adding women directors to its board, say women tech executives who have offered up candidates CEO [...] read »

snippet.title: Barrier Breakers: 15 Female College Presidents
snippet.description: Women are clearly making progress professionally: 15 of Forbes' 50 Best Colleges are woman-headed schools.

snippet.title: Oil's Customers Will Go Away Before Oil Does
snippet.description: A combination of much more efficient designs and advanced biofuels will allow the U.S. to wean itself off oil. read »
